section.p:
To create a new custom content template, take the steps below. The example shows the general approach to insertion of a simple template consisting of a single element. You can also create a template with an arbitrary structure (see ).
Create an element in the current document. The element will form your Custom Content template structure.
To select the element, right-click on it and choose Select Parent . Selecting a portion, you designate the template content for the Custom Content.
Go to Edit -> Custom Content -> New Custom Content or click the Create New Custom Content button on the toolbar.
In the Custom Content Dialog, specify Name , Inscription , Icon and Hotkey for the action or leave them as default.
If needed, adjust the content in the Content edit box.
If needed, enter the Node and select the Position .
If needed, make the custom content context-sensitive:
In the Content edit box, enter the content.
In the If matches edit box, specify context conditions for the content.
If needed, enter the Node and select the Position .
To specify more context-sensitive content templates, click the Add button.
Click OK .
